course_title: Research Topics in Political Science: Politics & Policy in Latin Am.
seats: Seats: Maximum Enrollment: 30 / Seats Avail: 25Waitlist Total: 0
class_notes: What explains Latin America's political instability? When and why do Latin American governments implement good policies? What explains the rise and fall of left and right-wing governments in Latin America? What are the causes of the underrepresentation of women and ethnic minorities in political offices in Latin America? We begin the course by discussing the long-run causes of development in the region by examining the consequences of Spanish and Portuguese colonialism. We then move to a discussion of public policies and the role of markets, corruption, and state capacity in shaping policies. Finally, we discuss party politics and elections by examining political unrest, gender and race politics, partisanship, and campaigning in Latin America.
course_description: Research on selected topics and problems in political science. Class will fulfill the "research" requirement for the political science major. May be repeated for credit when the topic varies.
prerequisites: POLS 208 or POLS_OX 208 or equivalent transfer credit as prerequisite.
